ublic financing for R&D and research collaboration in the energy sector is important for small firms,
ed countries, and it does not seem to crowd out
. Small US and UK firms accrue more patents and financing when

Overall, the body of literature on public R&D funding design in energy and climate related technologies
w to make the most of these direct RD&D investments in
energy technologies in the climate change mitigation space, including: giving researchers and technical
experts autonomy and influence over funding decisions; incorporating technology transfer in resea
organisations; focussing demonstration projects on learning; incentivising international collaboration
in energy research; adopting an adaptive learning strategy; and making funding stable and predictable
; Narayanamurti et al. 2009; Chan et al. 2017)
Without carefully designed public funding for demonstrat
ion efforts, often in a cost shared manner with
industry, the experimentation at larger scales needed for more novel technologies needed for climate
change mitigation may not take place. (

demonstration) in energy technologies plays a crucial supporting role (Section 16.2.1). Governments

Assessment of the impact on innovation and on competitiveness and distributional
outcomes of market pull policy instruments
Demand pull policies such as tradeable green certificates, taxes, or auctions, are essential to support
(Remer and Mattos 2003; Nahm and Steinfeld 2014; Wilson 2012)
investments, research has indicated that effective demand pull needs to be credible, durable, and aligned
and that the effectiveness of different demand pull instruments
. Historical analyses of the relative importance of
demand pull and technology push are clear; bo
th are needed to provide robust incentives for investment
in innovation. Interactions between them are central as their combination enables innovators to connect
a technical opportunity with a market opportunity
. It is important to note that these market pull polic
ies are often put in place
primarily to meet security and/or environmental goals, although innovation and competitiveness are
